attributes.action: Save the historic Annesley Colliery buildings from demolition
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Annesley Colliery, in Annesley Woodhouse, Nottinghamshire first opened in 1865, since it's closure several buildings were illegally demolished and all that is left now is one Headstock, the art-deco bath house and electrical workshop. The developer wishes to demolish these historic buildings to pave way for another housing development, please sign the petition if you agree that the three remaining buildings should be retained, restored and worked into the new development in a way in keeping with the historic nature of the site.
